Package com.tylerspaeth

Class Catchlog

java.lang.Object
com.tylerspaeth.Catchlog
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeletableCatchlog
public class Catchlog extends Object
This class provides the functionality of a Catchlog object that connects to a SQLite database. Funcionalities include but are not limited to: creating, reading, and deleting from tables as well as creating the tables and and database iteslf.
Author:
Tyler Spaeth

  • Field Details

    • tableName

      protected final String tableName

  • Constructor Details

    • Catchlog

      public Catchlog(String tableName) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is the constructor for a Catchlog object. It initiates a connection to the backend if there is not already an existing one, sets the tableName and creates a table for the tableName.
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name for the table that corresponds to this Catchlog
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given tableName is null

  • Method Details

    • insertToDB

      public void insertToDB(String flyType, int flySize, Catch.Water waterConditions, Catch.Weather weatherConditions, com.tylerspaeth.Catch.Location location, Timestamp timeOfCatch)
      This method inserts a new catch into the database.
      Parameters:
      catch - an object that represents all of the information that the user has given about the catch

    • getAllCatches

      public ArrayList<Catch> getAllCatches(Catchlog.Filter sortBy, boolean asc)
      This method retreives all of the catches from the database and puts them into an ArrayList which is then returned.
      Returns:
      a list of all catches that were in the database

    • removeFromDB

      public void removeFromDB(long rowid)
      This method removes a given catch from the database.
      Parameters:
      row - the rowid of the catch to be removed from the databse

    • getMostCommon

      public String getMostCommon(Catchlog.Filter filter)
      This method finds the most common occurence of a given filter and returns it as a string. For example if you give it Filter.FLYTYPE, it will give you the most common fly type in the database.
      Parameters:
      filter - an enum value corresponding what most common category to search for
      Returns:
      a string the represents the most common occurence of the given filter

    • getConnection

      protected static Connection getConnection()
      This method returns the appropriate connection object for use in the DetachableCatchlog. Using this method any other way is not reccomended.
      Returns:
      the connection to the sql database

    • getSubtable

      public DeletableCatchlog getSubtable(Catch.Weather weather)
      This method creates a DeletableCatchlog representing subsection of this Catchlog based on a certain Weather Condition. Does so by creating a subtable in the database
      Parameters:
      weather - the weather condition that all the catches in the new DeletableCatchlog should share.
      Returns:
      a Deletable catchlog that corresponds to this subtable
